params.domain: Domain of chain to get gas data for

returns.amortAttCost: Amortized cost for attestation submission (in Wei)
returns.dataPrice: Calldata price (in Wei per byte of content)
returns.etherPrice: Ratio of Chain's Ether Price / Mainnet Ether Price (in BWAD)
returns.execBuffer: Tx fee safety buffer for message execution (in Wei)
returns.gasPrice: Gas price for the chain (in Wei per gas unit)
returns.markup: Markup for the message execution (in BWAD)

params.contentLength: The length of the message content
params.paddedRequest: Padded encoded message execution request on destination chain

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Should be impossible to renounce ownership; we override OpenZeppelin OwnableUpgradeable's implementation of renounceOwnership to make it a no-op

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.domain: Domain to update the gas data for

getDecodedGasData(uint32).notice: Returns the gas data for the given domain, in the decoded format.

getGasData().notice: Returns the gas data for the local chain.

getMinimumTips(uint32,uint256,uint256).notice: Returns the minimum tips for sending a message to a given destination.

initialize().notice: Initializes GasOracle contract: - msg.sender is set as contract owner

localDomain().notice: Domain of the local chain, set once upon contract creation

multicall((bool,bytes)[]).notice: Aggregates a few calls to this contract into one multicall without modifying `msg.sender`.

setGasData(uint32,uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: MVP function to set the gas data for the given domain.

setSummitTip(uint256).notice: MVP function to set the summit tip.

updateGasData(uint32).notice: Fetches the latest gas data for the chain from `Destination` contract, and uses it to update the oracle values for the requested chain.

documentation.text:
@notice Initializes GasOracle contract:
 - msg.sender is set as contract owner
@notice MVP function to set the gas data for the given domain.
@notice MVP function to set the summit tip.
@dev Sets the gas data for the given domain, and emits a corresponding event.

@dev Returns the updated gas data for the given domain by
 optimistically consuming the data from the `Destination` contract.
@dev Returns the updated value for the gas parameter, given the maturity of the incoming data.

@notice `GasOracle` contract is responsible for tracking the gas data for both local and remote chains.
 ## Local gas data tracking
 - `GasOracle` is using the available tools such as `tx.gasprice` to track the time-averaged values
 for different "gas statistics" _(to be implemented in the future)_.
 - These values are cached, so that the reported values are only changed when a big enough change is detected.
 - In the MVP version the gas data is set manually by the owner of the contract.
 - The reported values are included in Origin's State, whenever a new message is sent.
 > This leads to cached "chain gas data" being included in the Guard and Notary snapshots.
 ## Remote gas data tracking
 - To track gas data for the remote chains, GasOracle relies on the Notaries to pass the gas data alongside
 their attestations.
 - As the gas data is cached, this leads to a storage write only when the gas data
 for the remote chain changes significantly.
 - GasOracle is in charge of enforcing the optimistic periods for the gas data it gets from `Destination`.
 - The optimistic period is smaller when the "gas statistics" are increasing, and bigger when they are decreasing.
 > Reason for that is that the decrease of the gas price leads to lower execution/delivery tips, and we want the
 > Executors to be protected against that.
